titles.title: Liberian Refugee Immigration Fairness Act of 2013
Liberian Refugee Immigration Fairness Act of 2013
To provide for the adjustment of status of certain nationals of Liberia to that of lawful permanent residents.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration And Border Security.

bill.summary:
Liberian Refugee Immigration Fairness Act of 2013 - Adjusts to permanent resident status a qualifying Liberian national who: (1) has been continuously present in the United States between January 1, 2013, through the date of status adjustment application; or (2) is the spouse, child, or unmarried son or daughter of such an alien.
Requires adjustment applications to be filed not later than one year after the date of enactment of this Act.
